Package com.google.inject.tools.ideplugin

Tools integrating guice with development environments.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
ActionsHandler The ActionsHandler responds to ActionsHandler.Action requests by taking the appropriate action, such as going to a given code location.
ActionsHandler.Action An Action is anything the IDE can do in response to a trigger.
JavaElement Representation of a Java element.
Messenger Responsible for displaying messages to the user.
 

Class Summary
ActionsHandler.GotoCodeLocation Represents the IDE action of going to a location in the code, i.e.
GuicePlugin The main object of the plugin.
GuicePluginModule Abstract module for the plugin's dependency injection.
 

Enum Summary
JavaElement.TYPE The types of Java elements that can be represented.
 

Package com.google.inject.tools.ideplugin Description

Tools integrating guice with development environments. The GuicePlugin object is the equivalent of the main() routine for standard applcations; it creates the injector and starts the plugin. IDEs create plugin parts themselves and hand them to us as static objects (or instances accessible in static objects) so we must bind these instances in our GuicePluginModule subclasses (which are IDE specific). The basic objects in our plugin are: ModuleManager - manages the modules in the user's code ProblemsHandler - notifies the user of guice related problems in the code ResultsHandler - manages results of user queries such as finding bindings BindingsEngine - performs the actual lookup of bindings in the code Key objects which must be created in IDE specific manner are: ModulesListener - listen for changes in the user's code involving modules ModuleSelectionView - allow the user to configure what modules the plugin runs ResultsView - displays results of searches, e.g. for bindings IDE specific objects for creating the guice context menu, e.g. "Find Bindings" are also necessary. The plugin is intended to be written simultaneously for all IDEs and use guice to inject the IDE specific implementations at runtime. See GuicePluginModule for more details.
